website_summaries.verdict: The Canon Pixma iP1700 is a bargain of a printer, especially considering its impressive print quality.
pros: great print quality for the price
cons: must print directly from your PC

customer_reviews.title: Bought for the size
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these for years and it finally broke down, so I bought another one. I wanted a simple printer that didn't take up a lot of space and this was the only one I could find. The quality seems adequate and though the printing is a little slow, it works for me, as I'm not in a hurry.
customer_reviews.author: may

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA iP1700
customer_reviews.text: The simplicity and low price and small size are what attracted me to this printer. It has served well in a clinical application which requires mainly black ink. The color cartriage is wasted on this application. I do whish the printer had a larger black ink tank. 5cc gets used up in a hurry. But the cost is low for replacement cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Keith L. Seidenstricker

customer_reviews.title: Canon IP1700
customer_reviews.text: Replaced defective IP1700. Decent text printer and adequate photo printer. Changing rating to 1 star. This second iP1700 also died after a short time. Canon will not repair because it is discontinued. Being an owner of an unrepairable printer Canon gave a $40 discount on PIXMA TS702 with no shipping charge. Have had it only short time but find it makes up for the shortcomings of the iP1700 and produces excellent text and beautiful photos.
customer_reviews.author: Frammus Friggle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the price
customer_reviews.text: My Epson died after only 1 year. Love this Canon. Pros: PRICE, PRICE, PRICE, ease of set-up and use, quite good print quality. Cons: printouts fall onto floor (no tray), print quality a little washed out (compensate by setting intensity higher, then looks excellent). I had no trouble locating inktanks, and they weren't any more expensive than the ones for my Epson.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Walsh

customer_reviews.title: New printer working well
customer_reviews.text: The printer was received on time, very good packaging, all instructions included in the box. only drawback is that the printer ink cartridge does not register any ink level, it prints great but always shows no ink in cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: N D

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer for Everyday Needs (Kids school papers, Airline boarding passes, coupons, etc.)
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this printer to replace an older model that we had for over 6 years. We really liked the printer because it was easy to use and the color printing is not bad for our everyday needs. This model is just as good as the 1600 & it came with a set of ink cartridges. The price on the printer was good on its own & it was a nice bonus to also receive the ink cartridges which are a $40 plus value.
customer_reviews.author: Jo in IL

customer_reviews.title: I got it for a little more than the ink costs!
customer_reviews.text: I had this same printer that was 6 years old. I print app. 4 blacks and 2 color cartridges every 6 months and usually bought ink in that quantity. Well, I just got an order and the old printer quit. So waying my options I found this new old stock of the same model. The quality and durablity of these printers will definately make me look to Canon inthe future.
customer_reviews.author: Russ R

customer_reviews.title: Good value for price
customer_reviews.text: Product meets my expectations and is working well. product was as advertised and no problems so far. Good value for price
customer_reviews.author: Paul G. Albanese

customer_reviews.title: Second PIXMA iP1700 I've owned
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific little printer. Takes up minimal space, and if I hadn't accidentally dropped the one I had before (disengaged something that I couldn't repair myself) I would still be using the first one after several years. I know it's reliable, and ink cartridges last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Pixie

customer_reviews.title: It works very nicely. I had to replace the printer due to ...
customer_reviews.text: It works very nicely. I had to replace the printer due to damage from a move and it did not disappoint me at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA IP 1700 printer bought from Amazon.com
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the printer (CANON PIXMA iP 1700) bought Amazon is horrible. On the website the condition of the printer was mentioned as "Good", but is really worst and has hardly worked. I feel cheated and frustrated. I even bought new cartridge considering that the issue might be due to the cartridge, but the printer is not at all working.
customer_reviews.author: Aparna k

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive printer
customer_reviews.text: Discontinued by Canon - theis company never really replaced it with another printer as flexible and dinexpensive as this one.
customer_reviews.author: S. Nuchtern

customer_reviews.title: NICE
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my purchase. And I was surprised that I could purchase the same printer 7 years after buying the original. Thanks, Steven
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it,love it!! Great product for a LOW price. If your needs are low in,I would buy this one. I also have a Canon Pixma MP500 that I like.This one is more for high in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An excellent printer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer to replace the same model that I had for several years. I feel fortunate to have located a new one and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: arlene messer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Cheerful and Colorful
customer_reviews.text: Cheap color inkjet. Advantage over the HP equivalents is that the ink appears to last twice as long. Fairly robust and fair quality for the cost. Hey, if it breaks, just get another. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Bufton

customer_reviews.title: Beware: Came without a color cartridge!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Be careful with this product. Mine came without a color cartridge. Had to spend money at Walmart to even setup the printer. Given the option, I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J TeVrucht

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have to use this printer with an older Mac since it is not supported in newer Mac OS.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have this as my picture printer and its the best one yet. With a great price!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lance Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Best yet
customer_reviews.text: This little printer is oddly the best printer I've ever had. Mainly because it's still working, it never fails to print. I've been using it steadily for three years and have yet to have a single issue with it. I'm no longer terrified about printing close to a deadline, or feeding the paper by hand, or jams. It just prints. And perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: G. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma IP1700
customer_reviews.text: The printer was easy to set up and get operating. It is a lot quieter and faster than the Epson model 820 that it's replacing. The only short coming that I have found to date is that will not accept envelope templates for odd sized envelopes that I had set up for the Epson. Ink usage is better managed by the Canon than the Epson. Also, heads do not need to be cleaned as often. I am waiting for Canon to provide an update to re-activate their "Easy-WebPrint" format. The new Explorer 7 will not accept it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Canon calls this a photo printer? Prints are faded, blurred, and distorted. Compare this printer to an HP Deskjet 3940 and decide for yourself. Do not invest in this printer. However, if you are stuck with this printer because you bought it as a package deal, either sell it on eBay or give it to your kids. I REPEAT, do not buy this printer, you will be sorry. Every Canon printer I have ever purchased has not met my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Steven T

customer_reviews.title: needs outer box
customer_reviews.text: product was just fine but delivery was not to my standards they left on my porch in view of street with original box so all could see luckily it was'nt stolen im in n.y. after all
customer_reviews.author: Alan Blomquist

customer_reviews.title: problems with cannon 3000 printer
customer_reviews.text: I cannot print only in black when I am printing text. Thus the other ink cartrages run out of ink causing the printer to stop.
customer_reviews.author: E. BAKER

customer_reviews.title: Why No USB Cable
customer_reviews.text: I am really not able to understand what is this cheap kind of strategy not to provide USB cable with this product, especially when thats the only interface available technically? Can someone make me understand the logic (business sense) behind this, especially for a Canon like brand!!??? Definitely, consumers expect much better from Canon. "Canon", please bring better business sense to market that would help end users/consumers. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Rajesh Singh

product_meta.title: Canon PIXMA iP1700 Photo Inkjet Printer (Gray)
product_meta.description:
You'll be amazed at the superb output that this compact photo printer delivers. Thanks to its patented print head technology, you can produce beautiful, long-lasting photos with borderless edges, from credit-card size up to 8.5"x 11". Plus, your documents will feature crisp, laser-quality text. It will even look great on your desk! For a no-compromise printer that's simple to use, this is an excellent value.

AMAZON.COM
Amazon.com Product Description The Canon PIXMA iP1700 Photo Inkjet Printer is an extremely user-friendly, efficient printer designed to meet all your printing needs in one compact, stylish unit. Need a hardcopy of directions to a friend's house? How about printing out photos taken over the weekend? Whatever your needs, the single function iP1700 gives you more choices, extra features and a better value. In addition, this printer features a unique cutting edge design that is very much in line with today's tastes and styles. No other entry level printer performs as quickly and efficiently while looking so good on your desktop.

 



The PIXMA iP1700 Photo Inkjet Printer is an extremely user-friendly, efficient printer designed to meet all your printing needs in one compact, stylish unit. View larger. 

This printer makes it easy to print and share digital photos at home. 

The iP1700 performs quickly and efficiently, while looking good on your desktop. 

Print Photos and More
The iP1700 makes it easy to print digital photos at home using the included Easy-PhotoPrint software. Or you can take advantage of the four color options and enjoy laser sharp text for documents and colorful web pages. For added convenience, the pigment black ink will even resist smudging when highlighted. You'll be amazed at the superb output that this compact photo printer delivers. Thanks to its patented print head technology, you can produce beautiful, long-lasting photos with borderless edges, from credit-card size up to 8.5 x 11 inches. Your documents will feature crisp text, making them eye-catching and easy to read. You can also print all the information you need from a website with just one click. If you're looking for a straightforward, uncompromising printer that's simple to use and looks great on your desk, the iP1700 is a smart investment. Print Resolution and Speed
Designed to deliver professional results quickly and efficiently, the iP1700 produces a maximum 4800 by 1200 color dots per inch (dpi) resolution for borderless printing in a variety of sizes including wallet, 4 x 6 inches, 5 x 7 inches, 8 x 10 inches, and 8.5 x 11 inches. The iP1700 also delivers print resolution of up to 600 by 600 dpi for black-and-white documents and 4800 by 1200 dpi for color printing. It prints 4 x 6 borderless photos as fast as 55 seconds, black-and-white documents up to 22 pages per minute (ppm), and color documents up to 17 ppm.

 ChromaLife100 For Image Permanence
The iP1700 uses Canon's ChromaLife100 system, including FINE print head technology, for eye-popping, high-quality photo printing. When you use select genuine Canon photo papers and inks, prints can resist fading for up to 100 years when stored in an archival quality photo album. The 100-year-lifespan rivals that of many traditional film based photos, long considered by consumers to be the benchmark for image permanence. Prints produced on Canon Photo Paper Pro with ChromaLife100 inks also have an up to 10-year gas fastness when exposed to open air. In addition, ChromaLife100 prints, when created using Canon Photo Paper Pro or Photo Paper Plus Glossy, have up to 30-year light fastness when displayed under glass.

 Launched globally by Canon in 1999, the Canon Full-photolithography Inkjet Nozzle Engineering (FINE) advanced print head technology is one of the keys to the impressive speed and high photo quality of the iP1700. FINE technology uses a ground-breaking high-performance, multi-nozzle print engine that ejects consistent and microscopic ink droplets. You can also take advantage of Canon's software packages to help edit and customize your prints. Easy Photo Print 3.5 software makes it simple to enhance and print amazing digital photos through your computer while Easy Web Print software gives Windows users the tools to properly print Web pages in full color without trimming off the right hand margin. The results are high-resolution photos and documents with sharp detail and clarity in less time.

 The iP1700 comes with a one-year limited warranty.

 
What's in the Box
Pixma iP1700 photo printer, cartridges (PG-40 black, CL-41 color), power cord, easy setup instructions, document kit (setup instructions and user's guide CD-ROM, quick start guide, registration card, and cross sell sheet.)
feature_bullets: Offers borderless printing in a variety of sizes including wallet, 4 x 6 inches, 5 x 7 inches, 8 x 10 inches, and 8.5 x 11 inches
Features four color options and pigment black ink that resists smudging; produces laser-sharp text for documents and colorful web pages
Produces a maximum 4800 by 1200 color dots per inch resolution for borderless prints
Dimensions: 17.2 x 6.5 x 10.0 inches (WxHxD); comes with a one-year warranty
Photo printer delivers 4 x 6 inch borderless photos as fast as 55 seconds

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars42 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
